This program is a linear search multiplicative order finder.

The multiplicative order of an integer ğ‘ modulo ğ‘š is the smallest positive integer ğ‘ such that ğ‘ raised to the power of ğ‘ is congruent to 1, modulo ğ‘š, given that ğ‘ is invertible modulo ğ‘š. ğ‘ is invertible modulo ğ‘š when ğ‘ and ğ‘š are relatively prime (coprime) one to the other.

The main loop steps over values of ğ‘ one by ono until a value is found that satisfies the aforementioned congruence. The two helper functions are a GCD (Greatest Common Divisor) finder via the Euclidean algorithm and right-to-left binary modular exponentiator.
